title: AB 1175
content: The people of the State of California enact the following: Section 9873 of the Business and Professions Code is amended to set fees for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers and service contractors. The initial registration fee ranges from $95 to $405 depending on the type of business. The initial registration fee for individuals in the electronic and appliance repair industry is up to $500 per place of business in the state. Those without a physical location in the state but still operate in the industry must pay the same fee. The annual renewal fee for service dealers is up to $205, and for service contractors, it is $95 per place of business if renewed before expiration. The annual renewal fee for service dealers in the electronic and appliance repair industry is up to $400 per place of business in the state. For service contractors, the fee is up to $475 per place of business. A delinquency fee of 50% of the renewal fee applies. This section is effective until January 1, 2019, unless extended by a later statute. The director cannot increase any fee before January 1, 2017. The initial registration fee for electronic and appliance repair service dealers is up to $205 per place of business, or up to $405 for those engaging in both services. The annual registration renewal fee for electronic and appliance repair service dealers is up to $205 per place of business, or up to $400 for those engaging in both services. The delinquency fee is 50% of the renewal fee. The fee for issuance and biennial renewal of licenses under this chapter ranges from $120 to $940. This section becomes operative on January 1, 2019. The curr_chunk provides information about different types of licenses related to furniture and bedding dealers, along with exemptions for certain individuals and retailers. Individuals making pillows, quilts, etc. in their own homes are exempt from fees, and retailers selling only "used" and "antique" furniture are also exempt. A person selling upholstered furniture and bedding must comply with fee requirements. Those licensed as furniture manufacturers or custom upholsterers do not need to pay an additional fee for a sanitizer's license.
